channel.title: RSBuddy Done
channel.description:
http://rsbuddy.com/forum/recent-developments-moving-bots-174891.html Was already posted on moparscape but I figured I'd post here too; Jacmob has come out and said that RSBuddy will not be returning, nor will other major bots
Recent Developments - Moving On From Bots [b]Why have you put an end to RSBuddy’s bot client? [/b] Bots have changed the gameplay of RuneScape. With the use of bots becoming increasingly widespread since the introduction of free trade, and the recent announcements by Jagex, it is clear that bots have become flagrantly detrimental to the game. If you’re like any of us and you enjoy playing RuneScape, you’ll have noticed that bots are anti-social and make the time you spend playing feel diminished in worth. At the same time, bots are abused heavily by gold farmers to ruin the game to a significant extent only for their profit. We hope to assist in the selfless movement by Jagex in fixing this problem and hope that you will join us in playing the game with real people. [b]Is this the end of all botting in RuneScape? [/b] Yes. I am confident that you will not see the return of major bot clients to RuneScape, and that the small number of simple 'auto-clickers' and 'screen-scrapers' that remain will be dealt with very soon. [b]Another bot site says they’ll be up soon; why shouldn’t we believe them? [/b] The other bot sites out there may claim for a bit longer that they will fix their bots within the next few days or weeks: Had I decided to release RSBuddy 1.5 to the public, it would have required another overhaul just a few days later. The fact that no other botting sites had any update ready by the end of last week shows how exceedingly far behind they are. Don’t hold your breath. [b]I know another huge MMO that hasn’t dealt with bots; what makes RuneScape different? [/b] Removing bots from the game requires both commercial investment and the time of talented developers with other updates to work on. I haven’t seen any other company willing to take that hit; it requires a huge amount of care for the game we’re here for. [b]I used RSBuddy on my account, am I going to be banned? [/b] The information we have on customers and users is private and won’t be used to ban any accounts. We hope that you have come to understand why botting has no place in the game and take this opportunity to become part of the RuneScape community. [b]I purchased a premium script, am I entitled to a refund? [/b] If you purchased a script within 7 days of the update last Tuesday we will happily refund your purchase on request. Any purchases made before this time are not eligible for refunds. Information on subscription changes is available on our subscriptions page. [b]This is the end for bots, not for you! [/b] It’s not only you that doesn’t have a bot client to use. RuneScape is a social game for humans to play. If you feel that there was anything botting did to keep you interested in the game, please join the discussion of what updates would remove any need for them.

item.title: RSBuddy Done
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Mopman:

@Mopar: There have been cases where bot manufacturers who make money from their bots have been successfully sued for tortious interference (basically “having a business model that depends on wrecking someone elses business”). It was one of the key points in the MDY vs Blizzard case iirc, the idea that MDY were encouraging people to break their contract with Blizzard, and that wasn’t a legitimate business model.

Which is why I think Jagex would have no case at all against a freely available, Open Source bot.

Read full topic

item.title: RSBuddy Done
item.dc:creator: @TehDew TehDew
item.description:
@TehDew wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:29, topic:420549”][quote author=Aff link=topic=523095.msg3808522#msg3808522 date=1320700708]
Would you rather release a bot, knowing that you would inevitably go through the same shit iBot is going through?
[/quote]

That is ridiculous as well, just creating/distributing/developing a bot is not grounds for a lawsuit from Jagex, there are plenty of perfectly legal ways to do it which Jagex has no say over. The lawsuit against iBot is about specific areas where they messed up, for example, using images copyrighted by Jagex without permission, and using Jagex copyrighted terms like runescape in their domain names. It isn’t a lawsuit on the grounds that they made a cheat for runescape.[/quote]

Please correct me if I am wrong MITB, but wasn’t the copy right claims just the tip of the ice berg?

Read full topic

The lawsuit against iBot is about specific areas where they messed up, for example, using images copyrighted by Jagex without permission, and using Jagex copyrighted terms like runescape in their domain names. It isn’t a lawsuit on the grounds that they made a cheat for runescape.

item.title: RSBuddy Done
item.dc:creator: @TehDew TehDew
item.description:
@TehDew wrote:

Jacmob was not just in it for cash. He also wanted to look like a god to the kiddies who purchased the scripts on his website. Since he could not get a stable version of the bot, or a working version, this is what he did instead. Mod MMG revoked the offer mid last week to hire anyone who created a bot that worked after the update, and they have not made any comments what so ever on hiring him(that I have seen). They probably had their lawyers hand him some paper work, told him to sign or be sued much like they did to Speljohan with Zetabot or w\e the name of the bot was.

Read full topic

item.title: RSBuddy Done
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[quote=“Aff, post:25, topic:420549”]I think it’s pretty funny that people actually believed Jacmob would publicly release the newly updated bot. Looking at how far Jagex is willing to go to attack bots (and botters), it was pretty obvious that RsBuddy was bound to be targeted. Jacmob made a pretty good decision; he took in the ad revenue from ~25k people on his site at once for a week and didn’t make the stupid decision by releasing the bot again.

Would you rather release a bot, knowing that you would inevitably go through the same shit iBot is going through? Or would you rather take advantage of the moment? Him being ‘dishonest’ is completely irrelevant because his decision was the smartest.

tl;dr stop bitching because he made money and is smarter than you[/quote]

implying that he actually had a bot to release.

Read full topic

Jacmob made a pretty good decision; he took in the ad revenue from ~25k people on his site at once for a week and didn’t make the stupid decision by releasing the bot again.

Would you rather release a bot, knowing that you would inevitably go through the same shit iBot is going through? Or would you rather take advantage of the moment? Him being ‘dishonest’ is completely irrelevant because his decision was the smartest.

tl;dr stop bitching because he made money and is smarter than you

item.title: RSBuddy Done
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Rix_, post:19, topic:420549”]That doesn’t mean what he says isn’t true. :rolleyes:

Anyway, if you read your IRC logs, you’ll see Jacmob mentioning that a few people witnessed RSBuddy 1.5. The bot would become difficult to maintain over the long run. That just reinforces Moparisthebest’s point – cheating on RuneScape (or any other game in general) is always possible.[/quote]So who are we to believe? All I know is he was doing lots of things to increase his page views, and lying about/faking all his release dates didn’t seem to perturb him at all.

‘Jacmob said’ – that’s the key phrase there. Again, you suggest we automatically assume what Jacmob says is the truth. I personally don’t believe he did get it to work (in a botting fashion, whether or not he got it to ‘load’ the client is not important). As to whether he was hired by JaGex, I don’t have a clue, but it’s not important. Nobody is saying cheating on RuneScape isn’t possible, almost everyone here knows about Simba and SRL.

Read full topic

item.title: RSBuddy Done
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Davidi2:

Yes, that’s what Jacmob has been saying the entire time. That doesn’t mean what he says is true.

That doesn’t mean what he says isn’t true. :rolleyes:

Anyway, if you read your IRC logs, you’ll see Jacmob mentioning that a few people witnessed RSBuddy 1.5. The bot would become difficult to maintain over the long run. That just reinforces Moparisthebest’s point – cheating on RuneScape (or any other game in general) is always possible.

However the ClusterFlutterer update is just the tip of the iceberg…

Read full topic

item.title: RSBuddy Done
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It certainly isn’t impossible to cheat on the game now or anything like that. Everyone said the EXACT same thing when Jagex killed Aryan with the 400 update, things like there will never be any big java cheats again, etc etc. If there is one thing I have learned over the years, it is that RS cheating never dies, it just takes breaks.

Read full topic

item.title: RSBuddy Done
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:15, topic:420549”][quote author=t4 link=topic=523095.msg3805723#msg3805723 date=1320448859]
from what i said at villavu:

t4:

He’s pretty wealthy (pre-RSBuddy) and he makes quite a lot of money from the project, why wouldn’t he just go an hire a professional Java engineering team to aid him if he personally couldn’t fix it. It sure smells like he sold his soul to Jagex.

[/quote]

Hah, why are you under the impression a “professional Java engineering team” would be able to get past this? Most professional Java programmers probably know less than the majority of the elitists at this community. It doesn’t take a lot of skill/knowledge to be a “professional” Java developer. Just saying…[/quote]
perhaps, but i’m sure a team could produce something more effectively than one person. (silabsoft offered this idea on irc)

Read full topic
